dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Rooney of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to authorize States to issue special permits to allow the operation of vehicles of up to 95,000 pounds on Interstate System highways for the hauling of livestock.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Highway Exceptions for Ranchers’ Deliveries Act of 2015.

section.header: Vehicle weight limitations for Interstate System highways
section.text: Section 127(a) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: A State may allow, by special permit, the operation of vehicles with a gross vehicle weight of up to 95,000 pounds for the hauling of livestock. The cost of a special permit issued under this paragraph may not exceed $200 per year for a livestock trailer.
